rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Thesis on secondary stresses in bridge trusses induced by riveted joints.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Munich, Bavaria, in a paper in which he drew the distinction between these stresses and Direct or Primary Stresses. To exemplify the nature and occurence of Secondary Stresses, consider a column of area A, moment of inertia I, supporting a disc of weight W. (Plate I) If the centre of gravity of the disc and column be in the same straight line as in Fig.1, the unit compressive stress in the column equals W/A = F = direct or primary stress.. This unit stress is uniform across the section of the column as designated by the stress diagram a b c d. [...]

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Sir Bartle Frere's policy in South Africa.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Sir Henry Bartke Edward Frere, usually spoken of as Sir Bartle Frere, was a noted imperialist of the middle Victorian era. One of the ablest administrators and greatest patriots of his day, he spent his whole life in the service of his country strying of forward, whenever he was, that great object of his life -- the Federation of the British Empire. rdf:Description.dcterms:title: On the influence of tensile stress on the thermal expansion of metals : II. An account of some experiments on the determination of stress in metals.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: If the coefficients of elasticity of a substance depend upon the temperature, an alteration in the state of strain of a body is accompanied by a change in its temperature. If a body is stiffer at a high temperature than at a low one, then, if the strain is increased there will be an increase in the temperature of the strained body, while if the body is stiffer at a low temperature than at a high one, there will be a fall in the temperature when the strain is increased. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Engeering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The work done by tube-mills in the wet reduction of ores.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The reduction in size of rock is performed in the mineral industry for the purpose of extracting the valuable constituents in the most economical manner. rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The subconscious.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The doctrine of "Petites Perceptions" as set forth by Leibnitz about two hundred years ago was the means of opening up a field of investigation, the interest in which has continued to increase until at the present day it is recognized that mental life can no longer be interpreted in terms of consciousness alone, a fact of such supreme psychological significance that Prof. James speaking in this connection says, "I call this the most important step forward because unlike the other advances which Psychology has made this discovery has revealed to us an entirely unsuspected peculiarity in the constitution of human nature. No other step forward which psychology has made can proffer any such claim". [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.

rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Train mileage cost is measurably uniform because each train requires an engine and a constant number of employees Especially is this true of freight service. The cost of fuel and engine accessories would vary with the size of the engine and would tend to make the train mile cost vary, but with trains hauled by the same class of engine this item would cost the same per mile. rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Some points on the development of Pleuragramma antarcticum.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Owing to the difficulties in obtaining material, the subject of the later larval development of Teleostean fishes is one which has received but little attention. Since the young of Teleostei leave the egg in an extremely immature condition, still bearing the remains of the yolk-sac, and are subsequently lost sight of until practically the adult stage is attained the question of the internal development is left in considerable obscurity.
